Class RLESequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • RLESequence

  • public class RLESequence
extends java.lang.Object
    RLESequence.java This program uses an ArrayList to compress the given array. The benefit for using this data structure is the ability to take in an unknown amount of data from the user, the ability to find, add, or remove Entries.
    Author:
    Akiko Iwamizu, AMI2119

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Entry> entries 
      private int length 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RLESequence(int someLength)
      RLESequence(length) establishes a RLESequence(in compressed form)from a given length and the default of the values is 0.
      RLESequence(int[] input)
      RLESequence(input)takes a standard 1D array of ints and creates its compressed form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void compress(int[] input)
      Takes input, iterates over it looking for runs of same values, and creates and fills the data structure ArrayList
      boolean equals(RLESequence myOtherRLESequence)
      Compares two sequences using their compressed form and determines if their contents are the same
      int get(int index)
      Gets the value of the element at index i of the original array
      int getLength()
      Gets the length of the sequence
      void increment(int byWhat)
      Increases or decreases every element in the sequence by the specified value Note: works for both positive and negative integers
      java.lang.String internalToString()
      Gets the compressed sequence as a String
      void set(int index, int newValue)
      Sets an element at index i of the original array to a different value
      void tailReplace(int position, RLESequence myOtherRLESequence)
      "Overwrites elements" by removing the entries after a given index and then appending the new entries to this sequence Note: I uncompressed the specific entry that will be changed instead of uncompressing the entire sequence to make it more efficient
      int[] toArray()
      Decompresses the internally compressed sequence
      java.lang.String toString()
      Used to debug and compare against the compressed sequence

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

        public boolean equals(RLESequence myOtherRLESequence)

        public int[] toArray()

        Returns:
        the uncompressed array form of the RLESequence

        public void set(int index,
       int newValue)

      • tailReplace

        public void tailReplace(int position,
               RLESequence myOtherRLESequence)
        "Overwrites elements" by removing the entries after a given index and then appending the new entries to this sequence Note: I uncompressed the specific entry that will be changed instead of uncompressing the entire sequence to make it more efficient
        Parameters:
        position - the index at which to begin appending values
        myOtherRLESequence - the instance's values to append

      • increment

        public void increment(int byWhat)
        Increases or decreases every element in the sequence by the specified value Note: works for both positive and negative integers
        Parameters:
        byWhat - the value to add to every element
